Hi welcome to Oluwafemi website!
I am currently a research assistant at the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) on the cocoa soils project. I obtained a Master’s degree in Agrometeorology from the University of Ibadan with distinction. Oluwafemi’s work involves studying soil properties, nutrient dynamics, and other factors that affect cocoa production in tropical regions. I have a strong interest in processed-based modeling, which focuses on simulating and predicting complex processes in natural systems. I also have a keen interest in Bayesian statistics, a powerful statistical approach that uses prior knowledge and probabilities to refine inferences. Additionally, I contribute to the R4DS online learning community as a mentor, helping aspiring data scientists learn R and its applications in data science. Overall, Oluwafemi’s expertise and interests demonstrate his commitment to employing advanced analytical techniques in his research and supporting the growth of data science.
